lessons.what: Pushed code directly to production without sandbox
lessons.lesson: ALWAYS work in sandbox first, never push to production without user approval
EVERY task gets its own Telegram topic, no exceptions
Always take screenshots with Puppeteer and send to topic before asking for approval

lessons.what: Orchestrator coded instead of delegating to koder
lessons.lesson: Orchestrator must DELEGATE to agents, never code directly

lessons.what: isBall variable undefined in modal tabs
lessons.lesson: Always check variable scope when using variables in array definitions
Specific routes must come BEFORE parameterized routes in Express

lessons.what: trust proxy not set for rate limiter
lessons.lesson: Behind nginx, always set app.set('trust proxy', 1) for express-rate-limit

lessons.what: Koder deployed dashboard changes directly without waiting for user approval
lessons.lesson: Even for non-production services like the dashboard, WAIT for user approval before deploying. The flow is: screenshots â†’ user reviews â†’ user approves â†’ deploy.

lessons.what: commenceTime saved as string not Date object
lessons.lesson: Always use new Date() when saving dates to MongoDB, not toString(). Mongoose won't auto-convert strings to Date type.
Never use hard limit() on queries that may return more results. Use pagination or remove limit for admin/internal queries.

lessons.what: rate limit exceeded from 300ms delay between API calls
lessons.lesson: When calling external APIs in loops, use at least 500ms delay. For bulk operations, use 1000ms+ or batch endpoints.

lessons.what: stale events not marked completed after date passed
lessons.lesson: Add a cleanup job or query filter: if event.commenceTime < now and status is not completed, auto-mark or filter out.
